clue: I am an operation on a non-empty set.
I involve two objects at a time.
Examples of me are union and intersection of sets.
I may be commutative or even associative.
I may have an identity on the set of operations.
I am a relation which is true for all values of the variable.
I am also a means of identification.
I am associated with binary operations.
For union of sets, I am an empty barrel which makes the most noise.
For intersection of sets, I am the whole universe.
For addition of real numbers, I am nothing to write home about.
I am the stuff Arithmetic is made of.
I am simply an operation or to be precise a type of operation.
I combine two terms to produce a third term.
Examples of me are the arithmetic operations of addition and subtraction.
Remember I combine two terms at a time.
